events.message: The client submitted a personal loan application specifying the need for medical expense coverage and some debt consolidation.
The loan application was reviewed and categorized under Personal Loan due to the medical and debt-related purposes stated.
A loan officer was assigned to the case to guide the applicant through the personal loan process efficiently.
The loan officer conducted an initial review of the applicant’s profile and the details concerning the personal loan request.
Additional documents such as proof of income, medical bills, and recent bank statements were requested to verify the loan application details.
The applicant submitted all requested documents, including medical invoices and income proofs, to support the personal loan application.
A credit check was performed, revealing a stable credit score with manageable outstanding debt, indicating a moderate risk level.
The risk assessment prioritized evaluating the applicant’s financial capacity and repayment history for the proposed personal loan.
An offer detailing the loan amount, interest rate, and repayment schedule was presented to the applicant for their consideration.
The applicant responded positively to the loan terms, expressing satisfaction and readiness to proceed with final approvals.
The application was escalated to senior management for final review due to the loan amount exceeding standard thresholds.
Senior management approved the personal loan application, acknowledging the thorough documentation and risk evaluation performed.
The approved loan amount was disbursed to the applicant’s bank account, enabling timely payment of outstanding medical bills and debt.
A follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant’s satisfaction with the loan disbursal and to offer assistance with repayment options.
The loan application process was successfully closed after confirming all post-approval procedures were completed.
